questions.question: It ………………….. not very expensive.
questions.description: It is singular subject. Hence we use is here.

questions.question: ……………………… make a noise.
questions.description: The subject of an imperative sentence is you. Hence, we use don't here.

questions.question: ………………………… the books on the table.
questions.description: The subject of an imperative sentence is you. Hence, we use put here.

questions.question: She ……………………………. harder than anybody I know.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: He was an unscrupulous guy who ………………………….. do just about anything to make money.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: She ………………………….. in the morning.
questions.description: When we say when something happened, we use the simple past.

questions.question: We ……………………….. swimming yesterday.
questions.description: When we say when something happened, we use the simple past.

questions.question: Heavy rains ……………………….. the city last week.
questions.description: When we say when something happened, we use the simple past.

questions.question: I …………………………. them only once.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about life experiences up to now.

questions.question: I knew I …………………………… a mistake.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.
